com.rad

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • com.rad.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class handles the GUI in running the window
    Author:
    Sources: rishi.pradeep, daniel.lee, akshanth.srivatsa
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        The constructor for Game. Creates a new window and starts the thread and game loop.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Represents the game loop for the game; loops continuously while the game is being played. The tick() method, which updates the game state, is called Const.FRAMES_PER_SECOND frames per second, while the render() method, which draws the screen, is called as often as possible.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the game. First loads all assets, then initializes fields, and finally starts the new thread to run the game on.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the game.

      • startPlaying

        public void startPlaying()
        Starts the actual game play. Called when the start button is clicked in the start menu.
